Uses of Interface
edu.luc.cs.trull.demo.counter.EventLabels

Packages that use EventLabels
edu.luc.cs.trull.demo.counter Demonstrates how bounded counters, control buttons, and clocks can be composed (run demo 1 run demo 1a run demo 2 run demo 3 run demo 4 run demo 5 run demo 6).  
 

Uses of EventLabels in edu.luc.cs.trull.demo.counter
 

Classes in edu.luc.cs.trull.demo.counter that implement EventLabels
 class ButtonComponent
          A component that emits an event each time the button is pressed.
(package private)  class ButtonReactor
          An adapter that causes a button to emit a Trull event.
 class CarryCounter
          A carry counter suitable for building a multi-digit counter.
 class CompositeCounter
          A composite counter suitable for building a multi-digit counter from two existing carry counters.
 class Counter
          A bounded counter implemented as a JavaBean with Trull support only for event emission.
 class CounterComponent
          A bounded counter implemented fully in Trull as a complex component.
 class Demo1
          A bounded counter component driven by a manual clock (run this demo).
 class Demo1a
          A bounded counter expression driven by a manual clock (run this demo).
 class Demo2
          A bounded counter activity driven by an automatic clock (run this demo).
 class Demo3
          A three-digit carry counter driven by an automatic clock (run this demo).
 class Demo4
          A pausable two-digit carry counter driven by an automatic clock (run this demo).
 class Demo5
          A three-digit carry counter driven by an automatic clock that stops upon overflow (run this demo).
 class Demo6
          A haltable two-digit carry counter driven by an automatic clock (run this demo).
 class Haltable
          A preemption wrapper around a component.
 class Pauseable
          A suspend/resume wrapper around a component.
